description:
For months, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has been insisting that the goal of Israel's bombardment in Gaza is to "destroy Hamas."

But in the path of that destruction, more than 33,000 Palestinian civilians have been killed. Regular people, entire families, and more than 13,000 children.

Yet, it's not clear if Israel is any closer to its stated goal of destroying Hamas. In fact, is it possible that the horrors of this war could ignite a cycle of radicalization in the region?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: Is Israel perpetuating a cycle of radicalization rather than ending it?

description: It has been three decades since the East African country of Rwanda experienced a genocide that changed the country and shocked the world. We look at the state of their society today.
title: What Rwanda Looks Like 30 Years After the Genocide

description: So far this year, the U.S. has seen more than 120 cases of the highly contagious disease — more than double the cases for all of 2023. Still, chances of widespread transmission remains low.
title: CDC warns that measles spike poses a 'renewed threat' to the disease's elimination

description: MacNeil, who created the even-handed, no-frills PBS newscast "The MacNeil-Lehrer NewsHour" in the 1970s and co-anchored the show for with his late partner, Jim Lehrer, for two decades, died on Friday
title: Robert MacNeil, creator and first anchor of PBS 'NewsHour,' dies at 93

description: President Biden said an attack by Iran against Israel could happen sooner rather than later. He said the United States will help defend Israel.
title: Biden says Iran could soon attack Israel, and warns, 'Don't'

description: U.S. stamps are heading for their sixth price hike since 2021. In raw numbers, only four countries in a recent study of 31 developed nations had cheaper stamps than the U.S.
title: The Forever Stamp is forever rising in price. How does the U.S. cost compare globally?

description: Iran blames Israel for a strike on its Syria consulate, and has vowed to retaliate. Iran's 1979 Islamic revolution transformed previously cordial relations between Iran and Israel to fierce hostility.
title: How Iran and Israel became archenemies

description: One of the most popular Ethiopian vocalists of the late 20th century, he rose to fame at a time of great political unrest in Ethiopia.
title: Ethiopian singer Muluken Melesse dies at 73

description: Although the Catholic Church officially opposes abortion, the report says there's far greater diversity of opinion among laity in the U.S.
title: 6 in 10 U.S. Catholics are in favor of abortion rights, Pew Research report finds

description: The holy month of Ramadan concluded this week with Eid al-Fitr, a celebration with food, family and friends. For Palestinians, the war in Gaza has weighed heavily on this year's holiday.
title: Palestinians forgo Eid celebrations to mourn for Gaza

description: O.J. Simpson leaves behind a complicated cultural legacy. Ukraine's parliament has adopted a law to mobilize hundreds of thousands of new soldiers.
title: O.J Simpon's complicated legacy; Ukraine passes new draft law

description: The men began their trip on Easter Sunday and had been gone for six days when a woman called the U.S. Coast Guard to report them missing.
title: 3 men stranded on a Pacific island were rescued by spelling 'help' with palm leaves

description: Four years ago, Bernie Sanders dropped his presidential bid and endorsed Joe Biden, helping Biden expand his coalition, including with young voters. Is another "unity" moment possible in 2024?
title: 4 years ago, Sanders and Biden united Democrats. Biden needs young progressives again

description: Mike Casey tells NPR that the scale of spying against the United States is "impressive and terrifying." He says: "More players are getting into it with more tools, going after more targets."
title: The U.S. counterintelligence head says the list of threats is long and getting longer

description: Why is a famous elementary particle in the news? Where is Chechnya and what did it ban? Which prince is Andrew again? If you know these things, you'll get at least a 3 out of 11.
title: Would you qualify for the jury on a Trump trial? Find out in the quiz

description: Scientific advances in immunotherapy and new targeted therapies have increased survival rates. But screening among former and current smokers still needs to improve to save more lives.
title: After 40 years of smoking, she survived lung cancer thanks to new treatments

description: Nearly 43,000 vehicles are impacted by the recall, including the 2022 Escape and the 2022 and 2023 Bronco Sport editions that have 1.5L engines.
title: Ford expands a recall of thousands of its Bronco and Escape editions

description: Truong My Lan, the 67-year-old chairwoman of the real estate company Van Thinh Phat, was formally charged with fraud amounting to $12.5 billion — nearly 3% of the country's 2022 GDP.
title: Vietnam sentences real estate tycoon to death in its largest-ever fraud case
